17  package com.okta.sdk.cache;
18  
19  import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
20  
21  /**
22   * A Builder to specify configuration for {@link Cache} regions.  This is usually used while building a CacheManager via
23   * the {@link CacheManagerBuilder}.  CacheConfigurationBuilders can be constructed with the {@link Caches Caches}
24   * utility class.  For example:
25   * <pre>
26   * Caches.named("cacheRegionNameHere")
27   *     .{@link #withTimeToLive(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) withTimeToLive(1, TimeUnit.DAYS)}
28   *     .{@link #withTimeToIdle(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) withTimeToIdle(2, TimeUnit.HOURS)};
29   * </pre>
30   * or
31   * <pre>
32   * Caches.forResource(Account.class)
33   *     .{@link #withTimeToLive(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) withTimeToLive(1, TimeUnit.DAYS)}
34   *     .{@link #withTimeToIdle(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) withTimeToIdle(2, TimeUnit.HOURS)};
35   * </pre>
36   *
37   * @see #withTimeToLive(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
38   * @see #withTimeToIdle(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
39   * @see Caches#forResource(Class)
40   * @see Caches#named(String)
41   * @since 0.5.0
42   */
43  public interface CacheConfigurationBuilder {
44  
45      /**
46       * Sets the associated {@code Cache} region's entry Time to Live (TTL).
47       * <p>
48       * Time to Live is the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
49       * longer be available.  If a cache entry ever becomes older than this amount of time (regardless of how often
50       * it is accessed), it will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
51       * <p>
52       * If this value is not configured, it is assumed that the Cache's entries could potentially live indefinitely.
53       * Note however that entries can still be expunged due to other conditions (e.g. memory constraints, Time to
54       * Idle setting, etc).
55       * <h1>Usage</h1>
56       * <pre>
57       *     ...withTimeToLive(30, TimeUnit.MINUTES)...
58       *     ...withTimeToLive(1, TimeUnit.HOURS)...
59       * </pre>
60       *
61       * @param ttl         Time To Live scalar value
62       * @param ttlTimeUnit Time to Live unit of time
63       * @return the associated {@code Cache} region's entry Time to Live (TTL).
64       */
65      CacheConfigurationBuilder withTimeToLive(long ttl, TimeUnit ttlTimeUnit);
66  
67      /**
68       * Sets the associated {@code Cache} region's entry Time to Idle (TTI).
69       * <p>
70       * Time to Idle is the amount of time a cache entry may be idle (unused / not accessed) before it will expire and
71       * no longer be available.  If a cache entry is not accessed at all after this amount of time, it will be removed
72       * from the cache as soon as possible.
73       * <p>
74       * If this value is not configured, it is assumed that the Cache's entries could potentially live indefinitely.
75       * Note however that entries can still be expunged due to other conditions (e.g. memory constraints, Time to
76       * Live setting, etc).
77       * <h1>Usage</h1>
78       * <pre>
79       *     ...withTimeToIdle(30, TimeUnit.MINUTES)...
80       *     ...withTimeToIdle(1, TimeUnit.HOURS)...
81       * </pre>
82       *
83       * @param tti         Time To Idle scalar value
84       * @param ttiTimeUnit Time to Idle unit of time
85       * @return the associated {@code Cache} region's entry Time to Idle (TTI).
86       */
87      CacheConfigurationBuilder withTimeToIdle(long tti, TimeUnit ttiTimeUnit);
88  
89  }
